Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey-black in section, the interior is slightly ribbed, the exterior is covered with a grey-white slip and faint traces of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394858) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394858)
